questions.prompt: King Dhritarastra cannot see the battlefield himself. What does he ask Sanjaya to tell him about?
choices: What his own sons are doing at the battle
questions.feedback: The king wants to know what his own sons are doing now that they have gathered.

questions.prompt: When soldiers blow conchshells loudly, what are they trying to do?
choices: Make announcements and show they are ready
questions.feedback: Blowing the conchshells is a signal that the soldiers are ready and united for the battle.

questions.prompt: Why does Arjuna ask his friend Krsna to stop the chariot in the middle of the battle?
choices: To get a drink of water
So he can see and recognize all the people who came to fight
questions.feedback: Arjuna wants to see who all is there because he knows these people and cares about them.

questions.prompt: When Arjuna sees his friends and family in the other army, how does he feel?
choices: Sad and confused about what to do
questions.feedback: Arjuna feels very sad because he doesn't want to hurt people he loves and knows.

questions.prompt: What happens to Arjuna's body when he is very sad and confused?
choices: It feels shaky and he cannot stand up straight
questions.feedback: When Arjuna is very upset, his body starts shaking and he has trouble standing because his mind is so troubled.

questions.prompt: What does Arjuna think about fighting his own family members?
choices: It will make him a great hero
It is good and he will be happy
It is wrong and he will gain nothing good
questions.feedback: Arjuna believes there is no good result from fighting people who are his own blood relatives.

questions.prompt: When families are broken and lose their good ways, what happens to the people?
choices: Bad things happen and good values are lost
They move to a new place
questions.feedback: When families break apart and stop following good traditions, the people suffer and lose important values.

questions.prompt: What happens to the ancestors of a family that forgets its traditions?
choices: They lose the honor of being remembered properly
questions.feedback: When families stop doing proper ceremonies and remembering their ancestors, the ancestors lose the respect and care they deserve.

questions.prompt: Why do people sometimes do bad things just to get power and wealth?
choices: Because they want to help others
Because their strong desire for things makes them forget what is right
Because they are forced to do it
questions.feedback: When people really want power, money, or other things, they sometimes forget about right and wrong, and that causes harm.

questions.prompt: At the end of Chapter 1, what is Arjuna's condition?
choices: He is excited and ready to fight
He stands with his weapons ready
He is so sad and confused that he sits down and cannot continue
He runs away from the battle
questions.feedback: Arjuna is so upset and sad that he puts down his weapons and sits down in the chariot, unable to do anything.
